page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: { }The area is very pretty indeed.There are no mountains or high hills, but the area is not completely flat.It is gently undulating.There are many walks along footpaths. Icomb is a place for farms.The land is mostly grazing and crops.There are no heavey industries in the area. There are no facilities like doctors,police,firemen or schools.People go to Bledington,a slightly larger local,village,to the primary school,a village shop,post office and the Kings Head,public house. Doctors,firemen, and larger shops are at Stow on the Wold and Chipping Norton. Icomb is a typically ,pretty Cotswold village but it has not been discovered yet by tourists and so it is unspoilt.
